poem:
Title: "The Forgiving Fountain"

Bled dry under monetary moons, Thames,  
Her tide tugged by coin's cruel clutch.
Waves wash in whispers of fiscal fear,
Where debts dive deep and resurface raw.
What irony, to excuse effluent echoes,
In the face of drowning pecuniary pressure.
Yet I speak for the silent stream,
Flow on, Thames, your solvency search.
Let not the sin of sewage stain,
Your silver story.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
